text: St. Cuthbert of Lindisfarne () was an Anglo-Saxon saint, bishop, monk and hermit. Cuthbert may also refer to: Places in the United States: *Cuthbert, Georgia, a city *Cuthbert, South Dakota, an unincorporated community *Cuthbert, Texas, a ghost town People: *Cuthbert (given name) *Cuthbert (surname) Other uses: *Cuthbert School, a one-room schoolhouse, later a high school, in Randolph County, Georgia *"Cuthbert", World War II Allied spy Virginia Hall's nickname for her prosthetic leg ==See also== *St Cuthbert (disambiguation) *Cuthberts Building, Johannesburg, South Africa
title: Cuthbert (disambiguation)
